content: Sudershan Reddy said he favoured a healthy debate and that his intention is not to speak lowly about his rival

title: Former Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar Vacates Official Residence
content: Jagdeep Dhankhar has vacated his official residence and moved to a private farmhouse in the Chhatarpur area of South Delhi, more than a month after he resigned as vice president. It belongs to INLD leader Abhay Chautala.

title: Heavy Rain Leads To Severe Waterlogging In Delhi, Gurugram
content: Huge traffic jams, heavily waterlogged roads, vehicles breaking down, scores of people stuck threw life out of gear as heavy rain hit Gurugaon Monday afternoon.

content: Reports of Bengali-speaking migrants being allegedly harassed in Maharashtra, Gujarat, Delhi, and Rajasthan have cast a long shadow over the season of celebration.

title: BJP Escalates Dharmasthala Central Probe Demand With March To Temple Town
content: Karnataka's opposition BJP is pushing ahead with its demand for a Central investigation into the huge controversy over allegations of murder and burial of young girls in pilgrim town Dharamsthala.

title: Over 800 Killed, 2,800 Injured In Afghanistan Earthquake: What We Know So Far
content: More than 800 people were killed and thousands more injured as a major earthquake struck southeastern Afghanistan late on Sunday, one of the worst such disasters in the country in recent years.

title: French Streamer Says 'Didn't Kill' Co-host In Live Broadcast
content: A French streamer whose colleague died during a live broadcast denied responsibility on Monday, in a case that has pitted the government against the Kick platform and spotlighted extreme online stunts.

title: Cash For School Jobs Case: Bank Accounts Of Arrested Trinamool Leader's Relatives Being Probed
content: The bank accounts, assets, and properties of the close relatives of Jiban Krishna Saha, who was arrested recently, are under the scanner of the Enforcement Directorate officials in connection with the cash for school-job case in West Bengal.

title: Debate Would Take Place If Both Candidates Speak: Opposition's Veep Pick
content: Alleging that his rival and ruling NDA nominee C P Radhakrishnan is "not speaking", INDIA bloc's Vice Presidential candidate B Sudershan Reddy said a healthy debate would have taken place had he spoken.

title: Chief Minister Sukhvinder Sukhu Declares Himachal Disaster-Hit Amid Heavy Rain Damage
content: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu on Monday declared in the state assembly that the hill state has been declared disaster-hit due to the extensive damage caused by cloudburst, flash floods and landslides over the past few weeks.

title: Rupee Falls 10 Paise To Close At All-Time Low Of 88.19 Against US Dollar
content: The rupee depreciated 10 paise to close at an all-time low of 88.19 (provisional) against the US dollar amid Indo-US trade deal uncertainties and higher dollar demand from importers.

title: FIR Lodged After Palestinian Flag Hoisted On UP School Building
content: Police have registered a case against seven people for allegedly hoisting a Palestinian flag on a government school building in Lakhimpur Kheri district.

title: Crisis-Hit Supertech Gives Possession Of 6,000 Flats But 15,000 Buyers Still Stuck
content: Crisis-hit realty firm Supertech Ltd, which is facing insolvency proceedings, has given possession of 6,121 apartments to its customers over the last three years across various housing projects, according to RK Arora, a former director.

title: Xi Jinping Seeks Development Bank For SCO To Counter US-Led System
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping said China would accelerate the creation of an SCO development bank on Monday at the summit of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization in Tianjin, as he seeks to expand the organization's influence and scope.

title: How Search For The Titanic Masked A Top-Secret Cold War Spy Operation
content: In the early hours of September 1, 1985, grainy black-and-white images of a metal cylinder flickered onto the monitors in the command centre of the research vessel Knorr. The team was searching the Atlantic seabed for the shipwreck of the Titanic.

title: 5 Killed As Pak Army Helicopter Crashes In PoK
content: An army helicopter crashed in northern Pakistan on Monday, killing all five people on board, the military said.

title: Married UP Man Missing Since 2018 Seen On Instagram Reels With Another Woman
content: He got married, had a child with his wife and then disappeared for years until being spotted on a random Instagram reel with another woman.

title: "Never Felt Better In My Life": Donald Trump Amid "He Is Dead" Viral Claims

content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's gestures at the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Summit were as clear as his words in defining friends and foes.

title: Plane Carrying EU's Top Leader Suspected Of Russian GPS Jamming

content: Vikas Yadav is the son of Uttar Pradesh politician D P Yadav; his cousin Vishal Yadav was also punished for the kidnapping and murder of business executive Katara

title: Amoebic meningoencephalitis claims two more lives
content: An infant and a middle aged woman passed away at Government Medical College Hospital in Kozhikode on Sunday

title: SC upholds Telangana's domicile rules for admissions in medical colleges under State quota
content: The impugned rules entitled only those students who have studied for the last four years up to Class 12 in the State to get admission in the medical and dental colleges under the State quota.

title: Karnataka secures spot in National Quantum Mission Board
content: State Government designates Ekrup Caur, Secretary in the Department of Information Technology and Bio Technology (ITBT), as the nodal officer for the Hub Governing Board (HGB) of the National Quantum Mission (NQM)

title: Amit Shah speaks to Punjab Governor, CM; takes stock of flood situation
content: During the telephonic conversations, the Governor and the Chief Minister briefed the Home Minister about the prevailing situation and the steps taken by the administration for the rescue and relief of the people affected

title: Commercial LPG prices slashed by ‚Çπ51.50 from September 1; no change in domestic cylinder rates
content: In Kolkata, Mumbai and Chennai, commercial LPG prices will be revised down to ‚Çπ1,684, ‚Çπ1,531.5, and ‚Çπ1,738, respectively, according to the Indian Oil Corporation

title: Chennai Corporation to purchase temple land for ‚Çπ18.85 crore to run a school after Madras High Court intervention
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh had fixed the consideration and persuaded the corporation as well as the temple to agree for a settlement in the interest of 2,500 students

title: Infiltration bid by terrorists foiled along LoC in J&K‚Äôs Poonch
content: The infiltration attempt coincided with the visit of Union Home Minister Amit Shah to the winter capital Jammu to assess the situation in the aftermath of the heavy rain and flash floods

title: Congress accuses Modi government of ‚Äòcowardly kowtowing‚Äô to China
content: After the Indian PM‚Äôs talks with the Chinese President, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh alleged in a social media post that it was the ‚Äòso-called elephant capitulating before the so-called dragon‚Äô

title: Home-grown innovations: KabadiMan rides to Belagavi Tech Meet 2025 on Hoopoe Electric
content: The event brought together entrepreneurs, corporate leaders, and innovators to underline how tier-2 cities, like Belagavi, are driving meaningful technological change and creating solutions with global relevance

title: India rains LIVE: Three killed in landslips as heavy rains wreak havoc in Shimla; Amit Shah chairs high-level meeting on relief measures in Jammu
content: ‚ÄúUnion Home Minister Amit Shah visited the flood-hit areas of Jammu,‚Äù officials said. Accompanied by Lt. Governor Manoj Sinha and Chief Minister Omar Abdullah, Mr. Shah stopped on the Tawi bridge near Bikram Chowk and inspected the damage along the riverbanks

title: Bihar SIR hearing highlights: ECI to accept claims and objections beyond September 1, SC told
content: The parties have urged the Court to direct the Election Commission of India (ECI) to extend the last date for receiving claims and objections to September 15, 2025

title: PM Modi at SCO summit: ‚ÄòNo double standards on terrorism will be acceptable‚Äô
content: PM Modi said India‚Äôs policy regarding the bloc was based on three pillars: security, connectivity, and opportunity.

title: India's MPL to sack 60% of local staff after paid gaming ban, source says
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government this month banned online paid games, citing financial and addiction risks especially among youth, leading to a shutdown of many gaming apps

title: Maratha quota stir Day 4: Jarange gives up water, protesters disrupt traffic in south Mumbai
content: With the deadlock continuing, Maharashtra Minister Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil said the government was working on a solution to the Maratha quota issue which will stand in the court of law

title: 'Brahmins profiteering': Trump adviser's remark on Russian oil trade sparks outrage
content: White House trade counselor Peter Navarro ignited controversy by accusing "Brahmins" of profiting from refined Russian oil sales to the West, escalating US-India trade tensions. His remarks, following accusations of India being a "laundromat for Kremlin," sparked outrage and were deemed inflammatory.

title: Trump rattled? US tries to cosy up to India as PM Modi meets Putin, Xi
content: The US Embassy in India affirmed the strong US-India ties, highlighting it as a defining relationship of the 21st century. Despite this positive outlook, trade tensions persist due to recent tariffs imposed by the US, citing trade deficits and India's Russian oil purchases.

title: Army dismantles TMC stage: Mamata urges force to not 'play into BJP's hands'
content: The Army dismantled a Trinamool Congress stage in Kolkata's Maidan, citing a violation of permit regulations regarding the duration of events in the area. Mamata Banerjee criticized the BJP, accusing them of using the Army, while urging the forces to remain neutral. TMC alleges political targeting and plans to relocate the protest.

title: 'Not for the ears of others': When Putin offered a lift to 'dear friend' PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Russian President Vladimir Putin engaged in an extended private discussion on Monday, taking place within Putin's Aurus limousine following the SCO summit. According to PTI reports, Putin offered Modi a ride, using the opportunity to continue their one-on-one talks for nearly an hour before their scheduled formal bilateral meeting.

title: Salesforce cuts 4,000 jobs: AI replace half of support staff; CEO flip-flops
content: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff announced a significant reduction of 4,000 customer support positions, a 45% decrease, as AI agents now handle 50% of customer interactions. This shift contrasts with Benioff's July statements, where he downplayed AI's potential for mass unemployment. The company is also utilising AI to address a backlog of over 100 million uncalled sales leads.

title: Ex-VP Dhankhar moves to private farmhouse ‚Äì what about his official house?
content: Former vice-president Jagdeep Dhankhar has vacated his official residence following his resignation and temporarily relocated to a farmhouse in Chhatarpur owned by INLD leader Abhay Chautala. This arrangement will continue until he receives a Type-VIII government residence, which he is eligible for as a former vice-president.

title: 'Bid to flare tensions': BJP slams Trump aide Navarro's casteist jab
content: Peter Navarro accused India of indirectly funding Russia's war in Ukraine through discounted oil purchases, alleging that Brahmins are profiting at the expense of the Indian people. He criticized India's high tariffs, claiming they hurt American workers and taxpayers while indirectly funding the Russian war machine. Navarro also expressed optimism about trade negotiations with China.

title: AI restructure at Meta: Wang‚Äôs memo to staff makes one thing clear - all report to him
content: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg is intensifying the AI race by reorganizing Meta Superintelligence Labs (MSL) into four specialized teams under Alexandr Wang's leadership. This restructuring aims to accelerate the pursuit of "personal superintelligence," consolidating research, product development, and infrastructure efforts. Key leaders like Nat Friedman and Aparna Ramani will play crucial roles in this ambitious endeavor.

title: 'Blatant interference by Russia': EU chief's plane hit by GPS jamming
content: Ursula von der Leyen's plane faced suspected Russian GPS jamming during landing in Bulgaria. Bulgarian authorities suspect Russian interference. The plane landed safely at Plovdiv International Airport. Von der Leyen was visiting Bulgaria as part of a tour. The region is vulnerable to "Russian hybrid threats."

title: Gold prices hit all-time high of Rs 1.05 lakh per 10g
content: Gold prices soared to a record high of Rs 1,05,670 per 10 grams in the national capital, marking the sixth consecutive session of gains. The surge was fueled by expectations of a US Federal Reserve rate cut and strong overseas demand. Silver prices also reached a new peak of Rs 1,26,000 per kilogram, driven by industrial demand and speculative interest.

title: Watch: What's key to success in politics? Gadkari's unique advise
content: Union minister Nitin Gadkari stated that honesty is challenging in politics, where deception can lead to leadership. Speaking at an event, he emphasized the importance of truth, non-violence, peace, humanity, and equality, drawing inspiration from Chakradhar Swami's teachings. Gadkari also highlighted the significance of values like honesty and dedication in society.

title: Parenting choice: Melinda Gates on picking daughter‚Äôs school; small choice, big impact
content: Melinda French Gates revealed that Bill Gates, despite his demanding role as Microsoft CEO, made time to drive their eldest daughter to preschool daily. This decision, initially a family negotiation, surprisingly inspired other parents to share domestic responsibilities more equitably. The car rides became cherished moments for Bill and his children, highlighting the importance of balancing work and family.

title: 'I feel ashamed': Harbhajan on slapping Sreesanth; calls Lalit Modi 'selfish'
content: Lalit Modi stirred controversy by sharing an old video of the infamous IPL 'slapgate' incident between Harbhajan Singh and S. Sreesanth. Harbhajan expressed his disappointment, suggesting a selfish motive behind resurfacing the 18-year-old incident. He acknowledged his mistake, reiterated his regret, and mentioned seeking forgiveness.

title: Over 800 dead, thousands injured in Afghanistan quake; villages flattened
content: A devastating magnitude 6 earthquake struck eastern Afghanistan near the Pakistan border on Sunday, resulting in a tragic loss of over 800 lives and leaving approximately 2,500 individuals injured. The powerful tremors caused widespread destruction, leveling numerous villages and buildings in the affected region. Rescue operations are currently underway, with medical teams dispatched from neighbouring provinces and Kabul to provide assistance.

title: Who is CEO Piotr Szczerek? Man who went viral for snatching a signed cap from kid
content: A viral video from the US Open shows Piotr Szczerek, CEO of Drogbruk, snatching a signed cap intended for a child, sparking global outrage. Social media users identified Szczerek, leading to a barrage of negative reviews for his company. Tennis player Kamil Majchrzak gifted the young fan, Brok, another signed cap.

title: 'Habit of chori': Kharge targets PM Modi - predicts end of NDA rule soon
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of attempting to steal votes in the upcoming Bihar assembly elections. He asserted that the NDA's double-engine government would soon be ousted, replaced by a government representing the poor, backward communities, and Dalits. Kharge also criticized Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's alliance with the BJP-RSS, questioning his socialist principles.

title: 'Hydrogen bomb soon': Rahul hints new expose on 'vote chori'; BJP reacts
content: Rahul Gandhi, leader of opposition, has accused the BJP of "vote chori" and promised a new expos√©, a "hydrogen bomb," following claims of similar electoral malpractices in Mahadevpura. He asserted that PM Modi would be unable to face the public after this revelation.

title: Chargers vs Chiefs YouTube coverage: ESPN bans Jason Kelce
content: YouTube's pursuit of Jason Kelce for its exclusive Chargers-Chiefs broadcast in Brazil was thwarted by ESPN. Kelce, now an ESPN analyst, is restricted from appearing on competitor platforms like YouTube due to a new company policy. This decision marks a shift from last season, as ESPN tightens control over its on-air talent amid the rise of streaming in live sports.

title: FIDE CEO slams Hikaru's claims of Carlsen Candidates favouritism
content: FIDE CEO Emil Sutovsky refuted Hikaru Nakamura's claims that the Candidates' rating qualification spot was designed for Magnus Carlsen's potential return. Sutovsky clarified that the rule has existed for years and now benefits top players like Nakamura. He emphasised the spot ensures the inclusion of the world's best, not specifically targeting Carlsen, whose return is deemed unlikely.

title: GST collections hit Rs 1.86L cr; 6.5% increase YoY
content: Goods and Services Tax (GST) collections demonstrated a 6.5% year-over-year increase in August, reaching Rs 1.86 lakh crore, as per official government data. The preceding month saw even higher gross GST collections, totaling Rs 1.96 lakh crore.

title: Polish CEO row: US Open incident sparks outrage; company Drogbruk faces review-bombing
content: A video of Polish businessman Piotr Szczerek grabbing a signed cap intended for a young fan at the US Open sparked widespread outrage. The incident led to a review-bombing campaign against Szczerek's company, Drogbruk, severely damaging its online reputation.

title: Bengaluru man chases live-in partner‚Äôs car, douses her in petrol; sets her ablaze
content: In Bengaluru, a 35-year-old woman, Vanajakshi, tragically died after her live-in partner, Vithal, allegedly set her on fire following a history of domestic disputes. Vithal, a cab driver, was arrested after he intercepted a car Vanajakshi was traveling in, pouring petrol on her and the other occupants at a traffic signal.

title: Night to remember! Rinku finally talks about that unforgettable 5-six finish
content: Rinku Singh's five consecutive sixes in IPL 2023 against Gujarat Titans catapulted him to fame, significantly raising expectations and earning him immense love. He acknowledges the match gave him a unique identity, not just personally but for India. His consistent performance has secured him a place in India's Asia Cup 2025 squad, where they will face UAE, Pakistan and Oman.

title: India reduces US Treasury bill holdings! Gold up in forex reserves; check details
content: India is increasingly favoring gold over US Treasury bills to bolster its foreign exchange reserves, mirroring a global trend of diversifying away from dollar-denominated assets. While India's US T-bill holdings decreased to $227 billion in June 2025, its gold reserves rose significantly to 879.98 metric tonnes.

title: 'Was never desperate to play for India before': Karthik lauds youngster
content: Dinesh Karthik praises Jitesh Sharma's mindset regarding national team selection. Karthik helped Jitesh refine his finishing skills while at Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Jitesh's IPL 2025 performance earned him a spot back on the Indian squad. He aims to solidify his position in the upcoming Asia Cup 2025. Sanju Samson is currently the preferred wicketkeeper.

title: Trump blasts MLB chiefs in push for Roger Clemens Hall of Fame spot
content: Donald Trump wants Roger Clemens in the Baseball Hall of Fame. He urged Clemens to sue Major League Baseball. Trump highlighted Clemens' achievements and denied drug use allegations. He compared Clemens' situation to Pete Rose's case. Trump criticized MLB for delaying Rose's consideration. He emphasized talent should be the reason for Hall of Fame induction.

title: 20% ethanol blended petrol: SC dismisses PIL against nationwide rollout
content: The Supreme Court has dismissed a PIL challenging the nationwide implementation of 20% ethanol-blended petrol (E20). The petition requested that ethanol-free petrol be made available and that ethanol content be clearly labelled at fuel stations. The plea argued that older vehicles and some BS-VI models are not compatible with high ethanol blends, potentially causing damage and higher repair costs.

title: ICC unveils Women‚Äôs WC 2025 prize money; surpasses men‚Äôs edition
content: The ICC has announced a massive 297% increase in prize money for the 2025 Women's Cricket World Cup, totaling $13.88 million. This surpasses the 2023 Men's World Cup payout, signaling a major step towards gender pay parity. Winners will receive $4.48 million, a 239% jump from 2022.

title: Noida: Man shoots self during birthday party after breakup with girlfriend; critical
content: During a birthday celebration in Sector 134's JP Cosmos Society, Vikram Thakur, a 25-year-old unemployed car driver, allegedly shot himself in the head. The incident occurred around 2:15 am, leaving Vikram in critical condition at a private hospital.

title: Boulders fall on tourist vehicle on Kedarnath route after landslide; 2 dead
content: A landslide on the Kedarnath national highway near Munkatiya claimed the lives of two individuals and injured six others on Monday. The deceased, identified as Rita and Chandra Singh from Uttarkashi, were struck by falling debris. The injured, also from Uttarkashi, are receiving medical treatment.

title: Maharashtra: Woman ends life during video call with boyfriend
content: In Thane's Titwala area, a 23-year-old woman tragically died by suicide during a video call with her boyfriend. Police have detained him following accusations from her family of harassment, blackmail, and cheating other women. Allegedly, he took her jewellery and threatened to release private videos when she asked for its return, leading to her desperate act.

title: Asia Cup | Samson vs Jitesh debate ends! Ex-India cricketer gives verdict
content: As the Asia Cup 2025 approaches, debate intensifies over India's wicketkeeper. Aakash Chopra favors Sanju Samson, citing his impressive top-order T20 record with over 6,000 runs at a 140 strike rate. Samson's recent explosive form, including centuries against Bangladesh and South Africa, strengthens his case.

title: SCO member states condemn Pahalgam attack in Tianjin declaration; express condolences
content: The Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) strongly condemned the terrorist attack in Pahalgam on April 22, 2025, expressing condolences to the victims' families. The SCO reaffirmed its commitment to fighting terrorism, separatism, and extremism, emphasizing that perpetrators must face justice. Following the attack that killed 26, India launched Operation Sindoor, targeting terror hideouts across the border.

title: IPL Slapgate: Match referee breaks silence; calls Harbhajan a good friend
content: Farokh Engineer, the match referee during the infamous 'Slapgate' incident in the 2008 IPL, expressed surprise at the recent release of the footage. He emphasized maintaining confidentiality and believes the matter should remain in the past, as both Harbhajan Singh and S. Sreesanth have likely moved on. The resurfacing of the clip has stirred reactions, with Sreesanth's wife expressing disappointment and anger.

title: Megan McArthur retires from Nasa: First woman to pilot SpaceX Dragon retires
content: NASA astronaut Megan McArthur retires after two decades of remarkable contributions, including piloting the SpaceX Dragon and crucial work on the Hubble Space Telescope. McArthur's career highlights her technical expertise and leadership, notably as the final astronaut to operate Hubble with the space shuttle's robotic arm.

title: Florida‚Äôs 'Alligator Alcatraz' to close: Detention centre empties; judge orders shutdown
content: Florida's controversial immigration detention facility, "Alligator Alcatraz," is set to close following a federal judge's order, highlighting tensions between state and federal authorities. The facility, built rapidly in the Everglades, faced criticism over its remote location, alleged unsanitary conditions, and restricted access for families and lawyers.

title: 'Jee Le Zarra': Farhan Akhtar confirms film still on cards
content: Farhan Akhtar has clarified that 'Jee Le Zaraa,' initially planned with Priyanka Chopra, Alia Bhatt, and Katrina Kaif, is not shelved but is currently on hold. While he's unsure about the original cast's involvement and timing, Akhtar confirms the script and pre-production work are complete. Alia Bhatt also expressed optimism, citing scheduling conflicts as the primary challenge.

title: Ankita Lokhande mourns Pavitra Rishta co-star Priya Marathe‚Äôs demise
content: Television industry mourns the death of Priya Marathe. She died at 38 after fighting cancer. Ankita Lokhande, her Pavitra Rishta co-star, shared her grief. She posted old photos and remembered their bond. Usha Nadkarni also expressed sadness. She recalled Priya's quiet nature and dedication to work. The industry remembers a talented actress gone too soon.

title: Over 300 dead in Himachal as heavy rains trigger landslides, floods
content: Himachal Pradesh has been devastated by relentless monsoon rains since June 20, resulting in over 300 deaths and widespread destruction. Landslides, flash floods, and road blockages have crippled the state, severely impacting agriculture and pilgrimage routes. Authorities are focused on relief efforts as more heavy rainfall is expected, with schools closed and warnings issued.

title: Avneet Kaur reacts to trolling after Virat Kohli 'like controversy'
content: Actress Avneet Kaur addressed trolling in light of the Virat Kohli controversy, emphasizing the importance of family support in navigating online negativity. She acknowledged feeling low at times but highlighted her family's role in reminding her of her dreams and hard work. Kaur urged people to spread positivity and neutrality, advocating against putting others down while expressing opinions.

title: Silver price today: Silver hits record high; crosses Rs 1.24 lakh mark
content: Silver price today: Silver prices experienced a significant surge, climbing by Rs 2,597 to exceed Rs 1.24 lakh per kilogram in futures trading, mirroring strong global market performance. This surge was fueled by factors such as increased US tariffs on Indian products, a weakening rupee, and investors seeking safe-haven assets.

title: 'Stigma of rape on perpetrator, not survivor': Delhi HC chides rape accused
content: The Delhi High Court reprimanded an accused, imposing a ‚Çπ10,000 penalty for suggesting that dropping a rape case would protect the minor survivor from stigma.

title: A's monitor Kurtz; Chourio returns for Brewers with homer
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the nationals are slated to call up Andrew Alvarez to start against the marlins . alvarez posted a 3.95 ERA and 1.35 WHIP as a 2nd .

title: 'No days off': Inside the pillars of Patriots' Mike Vrabel's hands-on coaching style
content: a former linebacker who became a head coach emerged with a bloody cut on his cheek . he was hired as the 16th head coach in the Patriots history in january . the former nfl player was tangled up with an defender on the ground during a practice .

title: Rating the new attacking signings: Sesko, Pedro, Gy√∂keres, more
content: it has been a record-breaking transfer window in the premier league with billions spent by England's top-flight clubs . it's worth around ‚Ç¨130 million, smashing the previous record set by Chelsea when they paid Benfica an initial ‚Ç¨106.3 million for Enzo Fern√°ndez . the new signings have enjoyed a mixed start .

title: Szoboszlai, Liverpool make statement start to 2025-26 in win over Arsenal
content: Dominik Szoboszlai scores one of the greatest free kicks in premier league history . the german beat arsenal keeper David Raya from 30 yards with a powerful right-footed strike in the 83rd minute . arsenal had controlled the game without being able to create clear chances .

title: PLL semifinals preview: Stats, matchups, how to watch
content: the 2025 premier lacrosse league playoffs continue this weekend on ESPN . the four teams travel to Subaru Park outside of Philadelphia for the semifinals . sports analyst Quint Kessenich revealed his keys to both matches . he will move ahead of casey Powel with four points .

title: Army player rescues man from burning vehicle
content: a second-year cadet at the service academy was traveling with his family when they saw a vehicle surrounded by downed power lines . the vehicle collided with a utility pole , causing the power lines to fall to the ground .

title: Projecting the CFP top 12 after Week 1
content: "the days of a national champion being undefeated are over," coach Steve Sarkisian says . the longhorns aren't alone, but the early results shook up the playoff pecking order . here's what the selection committee's top 12 would look like if it were released today .

title: Week 1 takeaways: What happened to Arch Manning? Is Utah the Big 12 team to beat?
content: our college football experts break down key takeaways from week 1 performances . the college football playoff selection committee will continue to use schedule strength to evaluate teams . if they do, that could be a problem for Alabama, Texas and Clemson .
